page.title: 11FARMING LANDSCAPES
page.content: The area grows sugar beet, barley and oil seed rape. The crops vary according to financial restraints or encouragements placed by the UK Government or the EEC. Presently the brilliant yellow of oil seed rape has been encouraged and in that season fields are a blaze of colour in the sunshine. Because of the spraying of fields by spraying units with arms many metres in length, the tractor drivers sometimes miss bits and there are red slashes of poppies across the fields. The seasons bring kaleidescopes of greens turning to gold. Then the skies are lit by the fires as the fields are burned off. There is opposition to this on the grounds of wasted resources; also on the damage of fires which get out of hand, black smuts of which fly for miles.
